title: Integration – Reading and Translation
goals: Integrate –āre verbs with known nouns and adjectives

steps.speak: Salve! Let’s warm up with endings: ō, s, t / mus, tis, nt.
Chant one verb together: amō, amās, amat, amāmus, amātis, amant.
Read aloud: Puella bona rosam portat. Identify subject, adjective, object, verb.
Translate together: The good girl carries the rose.
New sentence: Agricola parvam aquam laudat. What does it mean? Check adjective agreement.
Answer: The farmer praises the small water (note: in Latin school phrases, adjust to context: praises the small amount of water).
Student choice: Make one S–V–O sentence with an –āre verb you choose; say it in Latin, then translate.
Copywork (one line): amō, amās, amat, amāmus, amātis, amant — neat letters, clear macrons if available.
Faith phrase together: Deus nos amat — God loves us. Diligence is careful attention to meaning and form.
Preview: Tomorrow is our short mastery check. Practice chanting endings once at home.
